sense.name: central rotating part of a wheel or propeller
sense.examples: The spokes of a wheel are connected to the hub. Large hailstones struck the hub of the propellers on the twin-engine aircraft.

sense.name: a center or locale of social activity
sense.examples: The kitchen was the hub of their daily family life. The university is the economic hub of that midwestern town. Gentrification has made the waterfront the hub of night life in the city.

sense.name: an airport used primarily to route an airline's flights through
sense.examples: Atlanta is a major hub for two airlines. They offer no direct flights to Vancouver, you'll have to fly through their hub in Cleveland.

sense.name: a device that connects computers and devices into a network
sense.examples: John installed an Ethernet hub in their office. In the early days of computing, hubs were purchased over switches because of pricing issues.

sense.name: a steel punch used to imprint surfaces of coins or medals
sense.examples: These engraved hubs are used in the impressing process of making coins.
